name: readNode
description: Reads a single node's value.

name: writeNode
description: Writes a single node's value.

name: callMethod
description: Calls an OPC-UA method on the server.

name: callScript
description: Calls a server script on the server.

params.name: parameters
params.description:
The parameters to pass, given as a map of Variants, like
`{ name: { ... } }`.

name: createNode
description: Creates a new Node on the server.

params.name: options.parentNodeId
params.description:
The node's parent, defaults to the calculated parent
(`Test` for `Test.Child`).

params.name: options.typeDefinition
params.description:
The node's type definition, must be provided for
non-variable nodes.

params.name: options.reference
params.description: Name of the type of the node's reference to it's parent.

params.name: options.value
params.description: The node's value, required for all variable nodes.

name: addReferences
description: Adds references to a node.
examples:
<caption>Add a simple reference</caption>
import { ReferenceTypeIds } from 'node-opcua/lib/opcua_node_ids';

addReferences('AGENT.DISPLAYS.Main', {
  [47]: ['VariableTypes.ATVISE.Display'],
  // equals:
  [ReferenceTypeIds.HasTypeDefinition]: ['VariableTypes.ATVISE.Display'],
})
  .then(() => console.log('Done!'))
  .catch(console.error);

params.name: nodeId
params.description: The node to add the references to.

return.description: Resolved once the references were added.

name: path
description: The path to the project's configuration file.

name: ProjectConfig
description: The current project's configuration, with overrides (through ATSCM_PROJECT__ env vars) already handled.

members.name: host
members.description: The atvise server's host. Can be overridden with the ATSCM_PROJECT__HOST env variable.

members.name: port
members.description: The atvise server ports to use.

properties.name: opc
properties.description:
The OPC-UA port the atvise server runs on. Can be overridden with the
`ATSCM_PROJECT__PORT__OPC` env variable.

properties.name: http
properties.description:
The HTTP port the atvise server can be reached at. Can be overridden
with the `ATSCM_PROJECT__PORT__HTTP` env variable.

members.name: login
members.description: The login to use. Return false if no login is required (default).

properties.name: username
properties.description:
The username to log in with. Can be overridden with the
`ATSCM_PROJECT__LOGIN__USERNAME` env variable.

properties.name: password
properties.description:
The password to log in with. Can be overridden with the
`ATSCM_PROJECT__LOGIN__PASSWORD` env variable.

members.name: sourceNodeRegExp
members.description: A regular expression matching all source nodes.

members.name: ignoredNodesRegExp
members.description: A regular expression matching all ignored nodes.

members.name: isExternal
members.description: Returns true for all external (not in {@link Atviseproject.nodes} or ignored by {@link Atviseproject.ignoreNodes}).

members.name: timeout
members.description: The connection timeout, in milliseconds. Can be overridden with the ATSCM_PROJECT__TIMEOUT env variable.

name: InitTask
description: The action run when running "atscm init".

members.name: filesToHandle
members.description: Returns the globs of the processed files for the given config lanugage.

return.description: Globs of the files to handle.

members.name: run
members.description: Runs the task with the given options.

return.description:
Resolved with information on further actions
to run or rejected if the task failed.

name: ConfigLangs
description: A map providing dirnames for config langs

name: InitOptions

properties.name: atvisePortHttp

properties.name: useLogin

properties.name: atviseUsername

properties.name: atvisePassword
properties.description: The new project's atvise server login password.

properties.name: configLang
properties.description: The language to use for the new project's configuration.

name: InitOptionsAsArray
description: {@link InitOptions}, exported as an array. Required to run {@link Inquirer}.

name: InitOptionsValidator
description: A static class containing validators for the options used when running "atscm init".

members.name: name
members.description: Validates a project name to be a valid npm package name.

return.description:
Returns true if `value` is a valid npm package name, or an error
message otherwise.

name: encodeVariant
description: Returns a buffer containing a {@link node-opcua~Variant}s encoded value.

return.description: A buffer containing the encoded value.

name: decodeVariant
description: Returns a {@link node-opcua~Variant} from a Buffer with the given dataType and arrayType.

params.name: options.dataType
params.description: The data type to decode to.

params.name: options.arrayType
params.description: The array type to decode to.

name: Atviseproject
description: An atscm project's configuration.

members.name: host
members.description: The atvise-server's host. Defaults to localhost.

members.name: port
members.description: The atvise-server ports to use.

properties.name: opc
properties.description: The OPC-UA port the atvise-server runs on.

properties.name: http
properties.description: The HTTP port the atvise-server can be reached at.

members.name: login
members.description: The login to use. Return false if no login is required (default).

properties.name: username
properties.description: The username to log in with.

properties.name: password
properties.description: The password to log in with.

members.name: useTransformers
members.description: The transformers to use in this project. Returns a {@link DisplayTransformer}, a {@link ScriptTransformer} and a {@link NewlinesTransformer} by default.

members.name: nodes
members.description: The atvise-server nodes that atscm should sync. Defaults to the nodes AGENT, SYSTEM, ObjectTypes.PROJECT and VariableTypes.PROJECT.

members.name: nodesToWatch
members.description: The atvise-server nodes to watch in the corresponding tasks. Defaults to all nodes containing displays.

members.name: EditorRelatedNodes
members.description: An array of editor related node ids. They should be ignored in a atscm project.

members.name: ServerRelatedNodes
members.description: An array of server related node ids. They should be ignored in a atscm project as they are read-only.

members.name: AtscmRelatedNodes
members.description: Server nodes atscm manages itself. These include the serverscripts used during pull/push for example.

members.name: ignoreNodes
members.description: These nodes (and their subnodes, if any) will be ignored by atscm. Defaults to {@link Atviseproject.EditorRelatedNodes} combined with {@link Atviseproject.ServerRelatedNodes}.

members.name: inspect
members.description: Returns an object containing the properties to inspect.

members.name: vcs
members.description: The version control system to optimize tasks for.

members.name: preserveSortOrderNodes
members.description: If atvise builder sort order nodes should be stored.
members.deprecated: Mapping source order nodes leads to inconsistent results in many cases.

members.name: timeout
members.description: The connection timeout, in milliseconds.

name: ImportStream
description: A stream that imports xml files in parallel.

members.name: methodId
members.description: Id of the importNodes OPC-UA method.

members.name: inputArguments
members.description: Returns the arguments the importNodes needs to be called with for the given file.

return.description:
The arguments for the `importNodes` method:
 - The import scope (which is set to be absolute)
 - The XML code (read from *file*)
.

single entry).

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback called with an error if import failed.

name: reverse
description: Switches keys and values in an object. E.G.: { "a": 1 } becomes { 1: "a" }.

name: pick
description: Picks some properties from an object and returns a new object containing these.

params.name: properties
params.description: Names of the properties to pick.

name: delay
description: Returns a promise that resolves after the given duration.

return.description: A promise resolved after the specified delay.

name: promisified
description: Wraps a function with an async callback in a promise.

name: reportProgress
description: Prints the progress of a task.
examples:
<caption>A basic implementation</caption>
const task = doSomething(); // Returns a Promise

reportProgress(task, {
  getter: () => getTaskProgress(), // returns a number, e.g. 13 if 13 files have been written
  formatter: value => `${value} files written`,
})
 .then(result => { // Results get passed directly from `task`
   console.log(`The result is: ${result}`);
 })
 .catch(console.error) // which means you need error handling as well!

params.name: task
params.description: The task to print the progress for.

params.name: options.getter
params.description: A function returning the current progress.

params.name: options.formatter
params.description:
A function returning a log message for
the progress passed.

params.name: options.logResult
params.description: If the final progress should be printed.

name: sortReferences
description: Sorts the given references before they are persisted to disk.

name: handleTaskError
description: Adds additional infomation to the error's message and rethows it.

name: finishTask
description: Closes open sessions once a task is complete.

Creates a new NodeId. Can be called in multiple ways:

  • with a {@link node-opcua~NodeIdType}, a value and a namespace (defaults to 0),

whenever possible.

members.description: A map that maps node ids against their discovered hierarchical parent nodes. Used to detect reference conflicts.

name: NodeStream
description: A stream of server nodes.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates new node stream.

params.name: options.recursive
params.description: If the stream should recurse child nodes.

members.name: recursive
members.description: If the discovered nodes should be browsed as well.

name: QueueStream
description: A stream that process atvise server requests in parallel.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates a new QueueStream with the given options.

params.name: options.maxParallel
params.description: The maximum of parallel tasks to execute.

members.name: hasPending
members.description: true if there are queued operations or an operation is running right now.

members.name: queueEmpty
members.description: true if there are no queued operations.

members.name: processed
members.description: The number of chunks already processed.

members.name: opsPerSecond
members.description: The number of processed chunks per second.

members.name: processErrorMessage
members.description: The error message to use when processing a chunk fails. Must be overridden by all subclasses!.

members.name: processChunk
members.description: The function to call when a chunk is ready to be processed. Must be overridden by all subclasses..
examples:
<caption>Basic implementation</caption>
class MyQueueStream extends QueueStream {
  ...
  processChunk(chunk, handle) {
    client.session.doSomething((err, result, statusCode) => handle(err, statusCode, done => {
      // This is called if err is falsy and status code is node-opcua~StatusCodes.Good
      doSomethingWith(result);
      done();
    }));
  }
  ...
}

<caption>Implement a recursion</caption>
class RecursiveQueueStream extends QueueStream {
  ...
  processChunk(chunk, handle) {
    client.session.doSomething((err, result, statusCode) => handle(err, statusCode, done => {
      // Write the result back to the stream.
      // This means, that `result` will be queued and, as soon as possible, #processChunk will
      // be called with `result` as the `chunk` argument.
      this.write(result, null, done);
    }));
  }
  ...
}

<caption>Allowing some invalid status codes</caption>
import { StatusCodes } from 'node-opcua';

class FriendlyQueueStream extends QueueStream {
  ...
  processChunk(chunk, handle) {
    client.session.doSomething((err, result, statusCode) => {
      if (statusCode === StatusCodes.BadUserAccessDenied) {
        Logger.warn(`Ignored invalid status: ${statusCode.description}`);
        handle(err, StatusCodes.Good, done => done());
      } else {
        handle(err, statusCode, done => done());
      }
    });
  }
  ...
}

types: function(err: Error, statusCode: node-opcua~StatusCodes, onSuccess: function)
params.name: handleErrors
params.description:
Call this function to handle errors and bad status codes. When no error occured
and the status code received is fine, `onSuccess` is called. Further processing of valid
chunks, for example Recursions should happen in `onSuccess`. **Note that `onSuccess` is an
asynchronous function with a callback as an argument.**.

name: Session
description: A wrapper around {@link node-opcua~ClientSession} used to connect to atvise server. The sessions currentyl being opened.

members.name: create
members.description: Creates an {@link node-opcuaOPCUAClient} and opens a new {@link node-opcua~ClientSession}. If pooling is active, the shared session will be reused.

return.description:
Fulfilled with an already opened
{@link node-opcua~ClientSession}.

members.name: pool
members.description: Starts pooling (reusing) sessions. Note that you'll have to manually close sessions using {@link Session.closeOpen}.

members.name: close
members.description: Closes the given session. When session pooling is active the session won't actually be closed and the returned Promise will resolve immediately.

return.description:
Fulfilled with the (maybe closed) session or
rejected with the error that occured while closing.

members.name: open
members.description: The sessions currently open. Starting with version 1.0.0-beta.25 there will be one at most.

members.name: closeOpen
members.description: Closes all open sessions.

return.description:
Rejected with the error that occurred while closing the
sessions or fulfilled with the (now closed) sessions affected.

name: Stream
description: An object transform stream connected to atvise server.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates a new Stream and starts opening a new session to atvise server.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to use. See the through2 documentation for details.

params.name: options.keepSessionAlive
params.description:
If the ativse server session should be closed
one the stream ends.

emits.description:
Emits an `session-open` event once the session is open, passing the Session
instance.

params.description: The type's OPC-UA node id value.

params.name: identifier
params.description: Atscm's identifier for the new type.

name: AtviseTypes
description: The atvise types to handle. Ordering matters: The {@link MappingTransformer} takes the first match, therefore plain types should always come before resource types!

name: waitForDependencies
description: A mixin that transforms a regular stream into a {@link WaitingStream}, which makes it wait for a node's dependencies to be transformed.
examples:
<caption>Basic usage</caption>
import QueueStream from 'atscm/src/lib/server/QueueStream';
import { waitForDependencies } from 'atscm/src/lib/server/WaitingStream';

class MyWaitingStream extends waitForDependencies(QueueStream) {

  dependenciesFor(file) {
    return [
      // An array of node ids
    ];
  }

}

params.name: Stream
params.description: The node stream to inherit from.

name: WaitingStream
description: A {@link QueueStream} that waits for a file's dependencies to be processed before the file is processed itself.

name: Watcher
description: Watches the given nodes for value changes.

unknown.tagValue: {ReadStream.ReadResult} Emits `change` events when a watched node changes.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates a new Watcher with the given nodes.

members.name: subscriptionStarted
members.description: Resolved once the server subscription is set up.

members.name: close
members.description: Ends monitoring nodes.

name: WriteStream
description: A stream that writes all read {@link AtviseFile}s to their corresponding nodes on atvise server. The underlying {@link TreeStream} ensures the nodes are processed in an order that respects the parent-child relations between nodes. Nodes are created (if needed) before their children are processed.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates a new write stream with the given {@link CreateNodeStream} and {@link AddReferencesStream}. Implementer have to ensure this create stream is actually piped.

params.name: createStream
params.description: The stream that handles node creations.

params.name: addReferencesStream
params.description: The stream that adds missing node references.

params.name: options
params.description: The options passed to the underlying {@link TreeStream}.

members.name: processErrorMessage
members.description: The error message to use when writing a file fails.

members.name: dependenciesFor
members.description: Returns a files parent node and type definition.

members.name: processChunk
members.description: Writes an {@link AtviseFile} to it's corresponding node on atvise server.

types: function(err: Error, statusCode: node-opcua~StatusCodes, onSuccess: function)
params.name: handleErrors
params.description: The error handler to call. See {@link QueueStream#processChunk} for details.

name: CallMethodStream
description: A stream that calls an OPC-UA method for all input files.

members.name: methodId
members.description: Must be implemented in all subclasses: The {@link NodeId} of the method to call.

members.name: methodBaseId
members.description: The {@link NodeId} of the object from which the method should get called. Defaults to the value of {@link NodeId#parent} of {@link CallMethodStream#methodId}.

members.name: inputArguments
members.description: The input arguments the method should be called with for a file. Needs to be overridden by subclasses in most cases. Returning null indicates no method call is needed.

members.name: callRequest
members.description: Creates a call method request object for a file.

members.name: handleOutputArguments
members.description: Must be implemented by all subclasses: If the method call returns a status code of {@link node-opcua~StatusCodes}.Good, this method decides if the output matches the expected results.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Call this method with an error to indicate the method
call didn't work as expected.

members.name: processErrorMessage
members.description: Returns an error message specifically for the given file.

params.name: file
params.description: The file to generate the error message for.

members.name: processChunk
members.description: Performs an opcua method call for the given file.

types: function(err: Error, status: node-opcua~StatusCodes, success: function)
params.name: handleErrors
params.description: The error handler to call. See {@link QueueStream#processChunk} for details.

name: CallScriptStream
description: A stream that calls atvise server scripts for all passed nodes.

members.name: methodId
members.description: The id of the callScript method.

members.name: scriptId
members.description: Must be implemented by all subclasses: The id of the script to call.

members.name: scriptBaseId
members.description: Id of the script's base object.

members.name: scriptParameters
members.description: Returns the parameters to call the script with for the given file.

return.description: The parameters passed to the script.

members.name: inputArguments
members.description: Creates the raw method input arguments for the given file.

members.name: processErrorMessage
members.description: Returns the error message logged if running the script fails.

members.name: processChunk
members.description: Calls the script specified in {@link CallScriptStream#scriptId}. If the script does not exist but could be imported by running atscm import a special status description is returned.

types: function(err: Error, status: node-opcua~StatusCodes, success: function)
params.name: handleErrors
params.description: The error handler to call. See {@link QueueStream#processChunk} for details.

name: versionNode
description: The node containing the currently installed server-scripts version.

name: ModernPartialTransformer
description: A transformer that transforms only some of the files read.
examples:
<caption>Minimum implementation</caption>
class MyTransformer extends PartialTransformer {
  shouldBeTransformed(node) {
    return true; // or false
  }
  transformFromFilesystem(state, context) {
    if (!this.shouldBeTransformed(state.node)) { return; }

    // Apply actual transformation
  }
}

members.name: shouldBeTransformed
members.description: true if file should be transformed.

params.name: file
params.description: The file to transform or not.

name: SplittingTransformer
description: A transformer that splits a node into multiple source nodes when pulling.

members.name: extension
members.description: The extension to add to container node names when they are pulled.

members.name: sourceExtensions
members.description: The source file extensions to allow.

members.name: splitFile
members.description: Splits a {@link Node}: The resulting is a clone of the input file, with a different path.

params.name: newExtension
params.description: The extension the resulting file gets.

members.name: transformFromDB
members.description: Renames a container node, should be called by all subclasses.

members.name: readNodeFile
members.description: Returns false for all container nodes, so they don't get read.

return.description: If the node should be read.

members.name: combineNodes
members.description: Combines the container node and the source nodes to one single node.

members.name: transformFromFilesystem
members.description: Reads a given container nodes source nodes and combines them.

name: TransformDirection
description: The directions a transformer can be run in.

name: Transformer
description: The base transformer class.

members.name: combinedTransformer
members.description: Returns a function that combines multiple transformer actions.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates a new Transformer with the specified options.

throws.description: Throws an error if the given direction is invalid.

members.name: withDirection
members.description: Returns the Transformer with the given direction.

throws.description: Throws an error if the given direction is invalid.

members.name: readNodeFile
members.description: Determines if a node's value node should be read, e.G. The Variable.Bool file for a node defined in .Variable.Bool.Json.

params.name: node
params.description: The node to read or not.

return.description:
*true* if the node's value file should be read, undefined to let other
transformers decide.

members.name: transformFromDB
members.description: Must be overridden by all subclasses: Transforms the given node when using {@link TransformDirection.FromDB}.

members.name: transformFromFilesystem
members.description: Must be overridden by all subclasses: Transforms the given node when using {@link TransformDirection.FromFilesystem}.

members.name: compatTransform
members.description: A transform wrapper that works with both async/await (atscm >= 1) and callback-based (atscm < 1)transformers.

name: XMLTransformer
description: A transformer used to transform XML documents.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates a new XMLTransformer based on some options.

members.name: builder
members.description: Returns the XML builder to use based on the current {@link Transformer#direction}.

members.name: decodeContents
members.description: Parses XML in a node's contents.

members.name: encodeContents
members.description: Builds an XML string from an object.

name: importTask
description: Imports all xml files needed for atscm usage.

name: performPull
description: Pulls the given nodes from the server.

params.name: nodes
params.description: The nodes to pull from the server.

name: pull
description: Pulls all nodes from atvise server.

params.name: options.clean
params.description: If the source directory should be cleaned first.

name: performPush
description: Pushes the given path to the server.

name: push
description: Pushes {@link AtviseFile}s to atvise server.

name: WatchTask
description: The task executed when running atscm watch.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates a new watch task instance. Also creates a new Browsersync instance.

members.name: browserSyncInstance
members.description: The Browsersync instance used.

members.name: directoryToWatch
members.description: The directory to watch.

members.name: startFileWatcher
members.description: Starts a file watcher for the directory {@link WatchTask#directoryToWatch}.

return.description:
Fulfilled with the file watcher once it is ready or
rejected with the error that occurred while starting the watcher.

members.name: startServerWatcher
members.description: Starts a watcher that watches the atvise server for changes.

return.description:
Fulfilled with the server watcher once it is ready or
rejected with the error that occurred while starting the watcher.

members.name: initBrowserSync
members.description: Initializes {@link WatchTask#browserSyncInstance}.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to browsersync.

members.name: printTaskError
members.description: Prints an error that happened while handling a change.

members.name: handleFileChange
members.description: Handles a file change.

params.name: path
params.description: The path of the file that changed.

params.name: root
params.description: The root of the file that changed.

return.description:
Resolved with `true` if the change triggered a push operation,
with `false` otherwise.

members.name: handleServerChange
members.description: Handles an atvise server change.

params.name: readResult
params.description: The read result of the modification.

return.description:
Resolved with `true` if the change triggered a pull operation,
with `false` otherwise.

members.name: run
members.description: Starts the file and server watchers, initializes Browsersync and registers change event handlers.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to browsersync.

params.name: options.open
params.description: If the browser should be opened once browsersync is up.

types: Promise<{ serverWatcher: Watcher, fileWatcher: sane~Watcher }, Error>
return.description:
Fulfilled once
all watchers are set up and Browsersync was initialized.

name: watch
description: The gulp task invoced when running atscm watch.

params.name: options
params.description:
The options to pass to the watch task, see {@link WatchTask#run} for
available options.

types: Promise<{ serverWatcher: Watcher, fileWatcher: sane~Watcher }, Error>
return.description:
Fulfilled once
all watchers are set up and Browsersync was initialized.

name: LintTransformer
description: A transformer ensuring no invalid alarm condition filter nodes are pulled.

members.name: shouldBeTransformed
members.description: Returns true for all alarm condition filter nodes.

members.name: transformFromDB
members.description: Removes filter alarm condition filter nodes that have an invalid dataType.

members.name: transformFromFilesystem
members.description: Does nothing.

name: DisplayTransformer
description: Splits read atvise display XML nodes into their SVG and JavaScript sources, alongside with a .json file containing the display's parameters.

members.name: extension
members.description: The extension to add to display container node names when they are pulled.

members.name: sourceExtensions
members.description: The source file extensions to allow.

members.name: shouldBeTransformed
members.description: Returns true for all display nodes.

members.name: transformFromDB
members.description: Splits any read files containing atvise displays into their SVG and JavaScript sources, alongside with a json file containing the display's parameters.

members.name: combineNodes
members.description: Creates a display from the collected nodes.

params.name: sources
params.description:
The collected files, stored against their
extension.

name: MappingTransformer
description: A Transformer that maps {@link ReadStream.ReadResult}s to {@link AtviseFile}s.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates a new mapping transformer.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments passed to the {@link Transformer} constructor.

members.name: transformFromDB
members.description: Writes an {@link AtviseFile} for each {@link ReadStream.ReadResult} read. If a read file has a non-standard type (definition) an additional rc file is pushed holding this type.

params.name: node
params.description: The read result to create the file for.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occurred
while transforming the read result or the resulting file.

members.name: transformFromFilesystem
members.description: Writes an {@link AtviseFile} for each {@link Node} read.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Called with the error that occurred
while transforming the read result or the resulting file.

members.name: transformsReferenceConfigFiles
members.description: true as the mapping transformer should infer references from config files.

name: NewlinesTransformer
description: A transformer that handles newline characters in files. During a pull, all breaks are converted the OS-native EOL character and (optionally) a trailing newline is added (for better git diffs). On push, CRLF characters are used and those trailing newlines are removed again.

members.name: constructor
members.description: Creates a new newline transformer.

params.name: options.trailingNewlines
params.description:
If trailing newlines should be added. Pass *true*
for better git diffs.

members.name: shouldBeTransformed
members.description: Returns true for all files except binary ones.

members.name: transformFromDB
members.description: Adds converts line breaks to the current OS's native EOL characters and adds trailing newlines.

members.name: transformFromFilesystem
members.description: Removes trailing newlines and converts all breaks to CRLF.

members.name: transformsReferenceConfigFiles
members.description: true because we want to transform all files.

name: AtviseScriptTransformer
description: A transformer that splits atvise scripts and quick dynamics into a code file and a .json file containing parameters and metadata.

members.name: sourceExtensions
members.description: The source file extensions to allow.

members.name: processMetadata
members.description: Extracts a script's metadata.

params.name: document
params.description: The parsed xml document to process.

members.name: processParameters
members.description: Extracts a script's parameters.

params.name: document
params.description: The parsed xml document to process.

members.name: transformFromDB
members.description: Splits a node into multiple source nodes.

members.name: combineNodes
members.description: Inlines the passed source nodes to the given container node.

name: ServerscriptTransformer
description: A transformer that splits atvise server scripts into multiple files.

name: QuickDynamicTransformer
description: A transformer that splits atvise quickdynamics into multiple files.

members.name: extension
members.description: The container's extension.

members.name: shouldBeTransformed
members.description: Returns true for all nodes containing quick dynamics.

return.description: If the node is a quick dynamic.

name: cleanup
description: Cleans up after the app ended with the specified code or signal.

params.name: signal
params.description: The signal that triggered the exit.

return.description: `true` if the process should continue exiting.

name: getStat
description: Returns the {@link fs~Stats} for a path.

return.description:
Fulfilled with the requested stats or rejected with the error
that occurred.

name: validateDirectoryExists
description: Checks it a given path holds a directory and returns it's {@link fs~Stats} if found.

return.description:
Fulfilled with the directory's stats or rejected with the
error that occurred.
